episodes.title: 1 Week in America's "CULT CITY"
episodes.description:
1 Week in America's "CULT CITY!" What happens when you spend 1 week in America’s “CULT CITY”? We visited Maharishi Vedic City, Iowa, a place shrouded in mystery and known for its unique way of life. Often referred to as a “cult city,” this tiny town in Iowa is famous for its connection to Transcendental Meditation (TM) and Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, the spiritual guru who inspired millions worldwide. But what’s it really like to live here? Is it truly a cult, or is it just misunderstood?

In this video, we take you inside Maharishi Vedic City for an entire week to uncover the truth. From exploring their Vedic architecture, experiencing TM meditation practices, and learning about their organic, sustainable living philosophies, to talking with locals about their lifestyle, we dive deep into this intriguing town.

We also investigate the rumors and controversies surrounding Maharishi Vedic City, including its reputation as a “cult-like” community. What draws people here? What keeps the world curious about this unusual city in Iowa? And most importantly, what did we discover during our stay?

If you’ve ever been curious about Maharishi Vedic City, its mysterious vibe, and the unique practices that make it stand out, this video is for you. Watch until the end to see if it’s truly as mysterious as people say!

📍 Key Moments in the Video:
 0:00 Intro: Why are we exploring Maharishi Vedic City. What do locals think about “cult city”?
01:22 What is it like living in Maharishi Vedic City?
04:35 What happens inside the golden domes in Fairfield Iowa? 
07:51 Why astrology is important in the Transcendental Meditation movement 
09:29  Exploring the architecture: What is Vedic living?
11:06  Inside Maharishi International University farming and Ayurvedic principles
16:50 How does Transcendental Meditation work?
26:04 Inside Maharishi K-12 school 
27:25 Final thoughts: Is Maharishi Vedic City misunderstood?
 
Thanks for watching. We are super grateful you are here! 

Keep us traveling: https://theliveoutloudfamily.com/keep-us-traveling/

We appreciate your support SOOO much!
